title: Operating Room Clinical Nurse Coordinator
description:
Hourly Wage Estimate: $43.35 - $64.08 / hour  
Learn more about the benefits offered for this job.  

The estimate displayed represents the typical wage range of candidates hired. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have and comparison to other employees already in this role. The typical candidate is hired below midpoint of the range.

##### ***$10,000 Sign-on bonus for experienced OR RN candidates*** ***(Sign-on bonus not eligible for internal candidates)***

##### **Introduction**

Muscular-Skeletal Ambulatory Surgery Center is committed to investing in the latest technology enabling nurses to work more efficiently. **Are you passionate about delivering patient-centered care?** Submit your application for Operating Room Clinical Nurse Coordinator position and spend more time at the bedside with the patient.

##### **Benefits**

Muscular-Skeletal Ambulatory Surgery Center, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

* Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation.
* Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more.
* Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
* 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock
* Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance.
* Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more
* Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts
* Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships
* Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
* Colleague recognition program
* Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
* Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income.

Learn more about Employee Benefits

***Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.***

You contribute to our success let us contribute to yours! Whether you choose to focus on bedside care, a leadership or C-suite role, shape business and operational outcomes, or work to deliver clinical excellence behind the scenes in data science, case management or transfer centers. Unlock your potential at Muscular-Skeletal Ambulatory Surgery Center!

##### **Job Summary and Qualifications**

The Clinical Nurse Coordinator (CNC) ensures and delivers high quality, patient-centered care and coordination of all functions in the unit/department during the designated shift. In collaboration with other members of the management team, the CNC directs, monitors, and evaluates nursing care in accordance with established policies/procedures, serves as a resource person for staff, and models a commitment to the organization’s vision/mission/values to support an unparalleled patient experience and clinical outcomes that contribute to overall departmental performance.

**What you will do in this role:**

* Assists with admission and discharge processes to ensure efficient throughput and high quality, patient-centered care.
* Participates in the ongoing assessment of the quality of patient care services provided in the unit, in collaboration with other members of the management team.
* Collaborates with subject matter experts and other managers to create an environment of teamwork that supports improved outcomes and service.
* Supports a patient-first philosophy and engages in service recovery when necessary.
* Supports the efforts of the facility to improve engagement by operationalizing current nursing strategies, including employee rounding, hourly rounds, and other initiatives.
* Provides recommendations related to interviewing, selecting, and training new staff. Recommends and implements courses of action, including training and development, conflict resolution, personnel policy compliance, completion of performance evaluations, and/or disciplinary actions to ensure a competitively better organization.
* Assists with staff scheduling. Manages all practical aspects of staff labor in accordance with patient care needs and established productivity guidelines.
* Supports proper inventory control and assists with managing supplies and equipment.

**What qualifications you will need:**

* Graduate from an accredited school of professional nursing
* Minimum 2 years of experience, preferably in an ambulatory surgery center
* Active RN license as required by state of employment or appropriate compact licensure
* Valid BCLS Certification upon employment \\*\\*\\*online certification not acceptable
* ACLS as required by facility
* CNOR certification preferred

**Musculoskeletal Surgery Center** located in Thornton, Colorado. We have a long and distinguished reputation as aprovider of ambulatory surgical care since 2001. We offer the newest technology in our two operatingrooms and two procedure rooms. The center performs around 220 cases a month. Our specialtiesinclude orthopedics, ortho-spine, general surgery, cosmetic, ent, podiatry, pain management, anddental. We are part of HCA Healthcare and proud to be the first recipient of HCA's "Close the Loop"award for Clinical Quality Improvement. Our center is located near I-25 and the North Suburban MedicalCenter campus.

HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for thedelivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

  

Join a family that cares about every stage in your career! We are interviewing candidates for our Operating Room Clinical Nurse Coordinator opening. **Apply today and a member of our Talent Acquisition team will reach out.**

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

#ASD-AFHP
company_description: Surgery Ventures Powered by HCA Healthcare operates 130+ surgery centers across twenty states in the US.

title: Radiology Technologist
description:
Hourly Wage Estimate: $26.39 - $40.70 / hour  
Learn more about the benefits offered for this job.  

The estimate displayed represents the typical wage range of candidates hired. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have and comparison to other employees already in this role. The typical candidate is hired below midpoint of the range.

##### **\\*\\*\\* Up to $20,000 Sign on Bonus with 1 year Experience \\*\\*\\***

**Radiology Technologist**

**Full Time Nights**

Do you want to join an organization that invests in you as a(an) Rad Tec? At HCA HealthONE Mountain Ridge, you come first. HCA Healthcare has committed up to $300 million in programs to support our incredible team members over the course of three years.

##### **Benefits**

HCA HealthONE Mountain Ridge, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

* Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation.
* Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more.
* Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
* 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock
* Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance.
* Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more
* Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts
* Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships
* Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
* Colleague recognition program
* Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
* Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income.

Learn more about Employee Benefits

***Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.***

You contribute to our success. Every role has an impact on our patients’ lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. We are looking for a dedicated Rad Tec like you to be a part of our team.

##### **Job Summary and Qualifications**

This position supports the mission of HCA HealthONE Mountain Ridge of optimizing the quality of life of all those served by expanding beyond the traditional focus on medical needs to the needs of the whole person. Under the supervision of the Radiology Director, a Radiologist and the supervision of the supervisor of Diagnostic Imaging, the technologist performs procedures in accordance with established protocols for patients ages neonate through geriatric. Responsible for maintaining expert technical and patient-care skills and providing quality diagnostic results. When need arises, will perform other duties as assigned by supervisor. The ARRT standard of practice describes the clinical competency requirements and job responsibilities. The licensed independent practioner controls the ordering, preparation and administration of the medication/contrast. The LIP has given authority to competently trained technologist to perform this function under their control within the facilities guidelines and policies..

###### **What qualifications you will need:**

* ARRT or eligible
* AHA or ARC BLS
* Graduate accredited school of medical radiography
* Clinical rotation or 1 year experience

HCA HealthONE, one of the largest and most comprehensive healthcare systems in the Rocky Mountain region, offers more than 170 care sites in the Denver-metro area. Offering services across the continuum of care to meet patients’ total healthcare needs, HCA HealthONE includes seven acute care hospitals, a dedicated flagship pediatric hospital, a rehabilitation hospital, CareNow® urgent care clinics, mental health campuses, imaging and surgery centers, physician practices, home and hospice care, and AirLife Denver, which provides regional critical care air and ground transportation. Among HCA HealthONE’s acute care hospitals is Mountain Ridge (formerly North Suburban Medical Center), a 157-bed, Level II state-designated trauma facility. Mountain Ridge strives to meet and exceed the needs of the north metro Denver communities by also providing two freestanding, full-service emergency rooms and an outpatient surgery center. Consistently among the Denver Business Journals’ list of top corporate philanthropists in the Denver-metro area, HCA HealthONE was named as one of the most community-minded organizations by The Civic 50 and contributed more than $1 million through cash and in-kind donations last year alone, along with more than $400M in federal, state and local taxes.

HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in costs for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

  

"Good people beget good people."- Dr. Thomas Frist, Sr.  
HCA Healthcare Co-Founder

We are a family 270,000 dedicated professionals! Our Talent Acquisition team is reviewing applications for our Rad Tec opening. Qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. **Submit your resume today to join our community of caring!**

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: Esthetician
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Tips
* Commission pay
* Bonus opportunities
* Complimentary Icebox Membership
* Employee discounts
* Flexible schedule
* Bonus based on performance
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off
* Training & development
* Wellness resources

  
**Job Summary**  
Icebox Cryotherapy Studio is currently seeking a dynamic and experienced Esthetician for a full-time position at our Icebox Cryotherapy Westminster. This position is responsible for exemplifying Icebox's customer service philosophy, educating clients on services, and providing an exceptional experience through results-driven skin.  
  
**Responsibilities**  

* Perform client consultations for skin and body treatments including body sculpting.
* Perform a wide range of advanced skincare treatments, such as Cryo Facials, Cryo Body sculpting, chemical peels, dermaplaning, nano-infusion and other non-surgical treatments, tailored to individual client needs.
* Sell memberships and upgrades based on offering expert advice on skincare regimens, including product recommendations and lifestyle modifications, to maintain and enhance treatment results.
* Utilize equipment and technologies effectively and safely, adhering to established Icebox protocols and safety guidelines.
* Must be dependable, responsible, and punctual.
* Must be courteous and professional in manner and appearance.
* Collaborate with the Home Office Head Esthetician and Trainer to develop and R&D new products/protocols.
* Conduct post-treatment assessments, documenting treatment plans, progress, and any adverse reactions or complications.
* Enhances the guest experience by providing exceptional service.
* Maintains a positive attitude and contributes toward a quality work environment.
* Assist Wellness Coordinators on daily studio activity when not with clients including laundry, lead calling, appointment confirmations, cleaning.

**Qualifications**  

* CO State Licensed Esthetician
* 1+ years experience as a practicing licensed esthetician
* Credentialled in Dermaplaning and Nano-Infusion/Micro-needling
* Extremely detail-oriented
* Self-starter and passion for learning
* Strong sense of ownership and urgency
* Personable with clients and co-workers
* Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work well independently and in a team environment
* Be able to lift 50 lbs
* Weekend and weekday availability (two days staying until 7pm), we are closed on all major holidays.
* Strong Social media presence and willingness to self-promote to generate leads

**Company Overview**  
Icebox Cryotherapy Studios is a fast-growing franchise company revolutionizing cold therapy. Our innovative studios specialize in athletic recovery, pain management, wellness, and skin health. Our studio environment creates a modern and upscale spa-like experience. We believe in simplicity, offering a service menu focused on cutting-edge cold treatments. At Icebox, we pride ourselves on being approachable and inclusive, thereby attracting and catering to a diverse customer base. Icebox is on a mission to create healthier and happier communities, one freeze at a time!  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to Icebox Cryotherapy Studios Corporate.*

title: RV Porter
description:
**START YOUR JOURNEY WITH BLUE COMPASS RV – WE’RE HIRING A LOT PORTER!**  
Are you someone who enjoys working outdoors, loves RVs, and likes staying active throughout the day? Join our team as an **RV Lot Porter**—where your day won’t be stuck behind a desk, and every day is different!

At **Blue Compass RV** we haveover 100+ dealerships nationwide and offer a supportive, team-oriented environment where your hard work is appreciated, and your career growth is our priority.

### **COMPENSATION:** **$18-$24/hourly**

### **WHY BLUE COMPASS RV:**

* Structured Career Path – Start here, grow here!
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, FSAs, and Life Insurance
* Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
* Gas Discount
* 401K Retirement Plan
* Pet Insurance – because we love our pets too!
* 5-Day Work Week
* Employee Assistance Program
* Legal & Identity Theft Protection
* Ongoing Training & Career Development
* Employee Referral Program
* … and so much more!

**THE ROLE**

As an **RV Lot Porter**, you'll play a key part in keeping our lot looking sharp and our RVs ready for showtime. You’ll move RVs and trailers across the lot, help prepare them for customer deliveries, and support both sales and service teams. This is a physical, hands-on job that’s perfect for someone who enjoys variety and action in their workday!

### **WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**

* Safely operate a forklift to move trailers and RVs across the lot or into service bays
* Drive, stage, and arrange RV units with care and efficiency
* Assist with RV deliveries and make sure each unit is “wow” ready
* Ensure all slide-outs, steps, awnings, and jacks are properly secured
* Perform propane and fuel checks and refills
* Check in and inspect new inventory arriving from the manufacturer
* Keep the lot clean, organized, and professional in appearance
* Take photos of RV units as needed for online listings
* Run errands for parts and supplies
* Assist with minor repairs and help identify units needing attention
* Support with any other duties assigned by your supervisor

### **WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE**

* Forklift experience preferred (we can train you if needed!)
* Yard tractor or towing experience is a plus
* Can safely drive or maneuver RVs (or ready to learn!)
* Comfortable working outdoors in all weather
* Team player attitude with a strong work ethic
* Ability to lift/move up to 50 lbs with help from devices
* Willingness to learn RV maintenance basics
* Positive energy and a passion for doing a job right

### **JOIN US!**

If you're looking for a job that keeps you moving, lets you work with RVs, and offers long-term career growth with awesome benefits,this is your sign to apply!

Be part of the best team in the RV industry. Join Blue Compass RV and let your journey begin!
company_description: Blue Compass RV (formerly RV Retailer, LLC) is a leading recreational vehicle retail company and the fastest growing in the United States.

title: Barista (Part-Time, Main Library)
description:
Description:

The Barista is a member of an inclusive and collaborative team that models the library’s customer service philosophy and values-based service. The Barista creates a welcoming environment for patrons by greeting them and responding to their requests for service. The Barista is responsible for the day-to-day operations of The Bookmark Cafe, including but not limited to: opening and/or closing the cafe space, preparing made-to-order beverages, and selling food and drinks. The Barista is an integral part of the Patron Services team and the library as a whole.

Requirements:

**Essential Functions:**

* Engage with patrons in a friendly and welcoming manner, creating a positive experience for everyone. (25%)
* Prepare and serve a variety of high-quality coffee beverages, teas, and other refreshments to customers. (25%)
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, adhering to health and safety standards. (20%)
* Handle cash transactions, including operating a cash register and accurately processing payments. (15%)
* Monitor inventory and restock supplies to ensure that all necessary items are readily available for daily operations. (15%)

**This is a 30-hour-per-week, non-exempt, at-will role.**

The potential schedule for this position would be:

* ***Sunday*** - 11:30AM-5PM
* ***Mon-Thurs*** - 10AM-5PM

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with colleagues to maintain a smooth workflow and contribute to a positive working environment by communicating in person and through digital communications.
* Stay informed about cafe promotions and library events, and provide information to customers as needed.
* Takes proper safety precautions to prevent accidents.
* Responsible for the safety of self, others, materials, and equipment.
* Utilizes all required safety equipment and adheres to all applicable health and safety regulations, policies, and procedures.
* Report all accidents and damage to library property.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* **Education and Experience:** A minimum of 1 year of work experience as a barista and with direct customer service. Experience independently prioritizing tasks in a rapidly fluctuating work environment to meet customer needs and library expectations.
* **Skills:** Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills with a friendly and approachable demeanor. Basic math skills for performing cash and credit transactions.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Food Handler's license
* Flexibility in scheduling, including weekends and evenings
* Spanish language skills and/or experience working with patrons from a variety of ethnic and cultural backgrounds

**Working Conditions:**

Primarily physical work with repetitive handling of items, frequent walking and standing, and occasional lifting of items up to 40 pounds. Requires sufficient manual dexterity that permits the employee to operate restaurant equipment. Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, which allow the employee to work in a multilevel facility. Seeing, hearing, and speaking are required.

**Health and Wellness Benefits**

* Group medical, dental, and vision benefits to employees who work 20 hours or more per week
* Lifestyle Spending Account for all benefit-eligible employees
* Employer-paid basic life and long-term disability insurance
* Employer-paid employee assistance program for employees and their household members
* Health Savings Accounts or Flexible Spending Accounts for all benefit-eligible employees
* Voluntary, employee-paid, group accident, critical illness, and hospital indemnity plans for all benefit-eligible employees
* Employees who work 20 hours or more per week are eligible to take up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave following the birth of an employee’s child or the placement of a child with an employee for adoption or foster care
* Infant at Work Program

**Time-off Benefits**

* New employees accrue 2 weeks of paid vacation
* 80 hours of paid sick leave per year for employees who work 20 hours or more per week
* 12 paid holidays and 2 days of floating holidays
* Time off for jury duty, bereavement, and voting
* Pet adoption leave
* New grandparent leave

**Helping Your Future**

* Public Employee Retirement Association of Colorado (PERA) Defined Benefit Plan or PERA Defined Contribution Plan
* PERA 401(k) Plan
* Tuition reimbursement program and student debt repayment assistance
* Paid training and professional development

**Library Perks**

Easy access to unlimited resources—books, movies, programs, digital technology, and more.

**Please apply by June 18th at 4 pm. Interviews for the role will begin the following week.**

-

**Application Accommodations**

BPLD is committed to advancing equity in our diverse community, and jobs are one great way for us to do this. Please let us know if you require accommodations due to a disability to apply for this position.

**Examples of this could include:** A paper copy of the application, emailing the interview questions to you in advance via email, or reading the application to an applicant with visual impairment. This is not an exhaustive list.

**Please note a few things:**

* If you need more time to complete any sections of the application, we recommend using a word processing document or text file to fill out the answers. The system times out after 30 minutes and does not retain your information. Having it in a word processing document will help in case you need to copy and paste the information back into the application. *There is a 1000-character limit for responses to those questions.*
* Uploading documents and qualifications can impact the formatting of your resume. We *will no*t discount your application if Paylocity transcription alters the formatting.

**Reach us at:** hr@boulderlibrary.org, and we will work with you to see if we can accommodate.

title: Junk Removal Team Mate
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Employee discounts
* Flexible schedule
* Opportunity for advancement

  
Job Title: Junk Removal Team Mate  
Location: Denver and Surronding areas  
Employment Type: Part-Time  
  
About E4M Services  
  
E4M Services is a trusted provider of efficient, eco-friendly junk removal solutions. We are committed to exceptional customer service, sustainability, and making a positive impact in our community.  

* Junk removal
* E-waste Recycling
* Demolition Both Commercial/Residential
* Scrap Metal Recycling

  
Position Overview  
We are seeking a motivated and hardworking Junk Removal Team Mate to join our team. This role involves heavy lifting, customer interaction, and opportunities to make a difference through recycling, donations, and eco-friendly waste disposal. You’ll also have access to free household items and earn cash while being part of a supportive team environment.  
  
Key Responsibilities  
  
Heavy Lifting: Safely load, unload, and transport heavy items (up to 75 lbs) with care and efficiency.  
Recycling and Donations: Sort items to maximize recycling efforts and facilitate donations to local charities.  
Customer Service: Provide friendly and professional service, ensuring customer satisfaction at every job.  
Free Household Items: Assist with redistributing usable items that are free to team members or others in need.  
Cash Payment: Earn competitive pay with opportunities for additional cash bonuses based on performance.  
Equipment Maintenance: Keep trucks and equipment clean, organized, and in good working condition.  
Collaborate with team members to complete projects effectively and on schedule.  
Qualifications  
  
Experience in a physically demanding role is a plus but not required.  
Ability to lift and carry heavy items safely.  
Positive attitude and strong communication skills.  
A passion for recycling, sustainability, and making a difference in the community.  
Valid driver’s license (preferred but not mandatory).  
Flexibility to work varying hours, including weekends.  
Why Join E4M Services?  
  
Competitive pay with cash payment options.  
Access to free household items collected during jobs.  
Opportunities to contribute to eco-friendly recycling and donation programs.  
A collaborative, friendly team environment.  
Room for growth and advancement within the company.  
How to Apply  
If you’re ready to join a team that values hard work, community impact, and sustainability, we want to hear from you!  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to Blue Moon Estate Sales Corporate.*

title: Inside Sales Rep
description:
**About the Role:** As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be responsible for generating sales opportunities and providing exceptional customer service to homeowners. Your excellent communication skills, persuasive abilities, and product knowledge will be vital in converting leads into satisfied customers. Working closely with the sales team, you will play a pivotal role in achieving and exceeding sales targets.

**About Us:**

At Lion Home Service, we’re not just in the service business, we’re in the business of improving lives. You will be an essential part of our team’s meaningful contribution to the world.

“We’re setting a new standard of excellence in the industry. It starts with YOU. Every word, action, and decision has the potential to benefit our clients, our team, and contribute to our success. Embed these core values into your thoughts and actions. Together we’ll continue to push higher.”

* Barton J. Palmer, Founder

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Respond promptly and professionally to inbound customer inquiries via phone, email, and online channels.
* Engage with homeowners, understanding their service needs, and recommending suitable HVAC, plumbing, or electrical solutions.
* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our products, services, and pricing structures to confidently address customer queries.
* Build rapport and establish trust with customers by delivering exceptional customer service and addressing their concerns.
* Proactively make outbound calls to follow up on leads, answer questions, and convert prospects into customers.
* Collaborate closely with the sales team to coordinate customer appointments and ensure a smooth sales process.
* Provide accurate and detailed information about products, services, promotions, and pricing to customers.
* Maintain customer records, update the CRM system, and track sales activities to ensure accurate reporting.
* Achieve and exceed sales targets and quotas, contributing to the overall success of the sales team.
* Continuously learn and stay up-to-date on industry trends, product knowledge, and sales techniques through training and professional development opportunities.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to support sales campaigns, promotions, and lead generation initiatives.
* Work with the service and installation teams to ensure seamless customer experiences and satisfaction.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of sales processes and customer service initiatives.

**Qualifi****cations:**

* Proven experience in inside sales, preferably within the residential service industry.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively engage with customers.
* Strong customer service orientation, with a passion for delivering exceptional customer experiences.
* Persuasive and influential with the ability to handle objections and close sales.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and multitasking skills.
* Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and prioritize tasks.
* Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales tools.
* Technical knowledge of HVAC, plumbing, or electrical systems is a plus.
* Goal-oriented mindset with a drive to achieve and exceed sales targets.
* Positive attitude and a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

**Interpersonal Qualifications:**

* Customer service focus and mindset, putting our employees and Partners first, with excellent ability to communicate and develop relationships.
* Exceptional problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities to improve things both big and small.
* Highly organized, ability to act quickly while still having attention to detail.
* Hold yourself to a higher standard and exhibit a high level of integrity.

**Why You’ll Want to Work Here:**

* Core values that we live every day – not just words on a page: ***We Win Together, Today Not Tomorrow, Performance Not Politics***
* *Performance Pay directly tied to results* – Get what you deserve
* *Benefits you will use* – Full medical, dental, and vision packages including fully employer paid options
* *Secure your financial future* – 401(k) with company match
* *Speed and scale* – Work with a company that operates at the speed of a start up with the investment backing of institutional investors
* *We invest in your future* – leadership training that directly results into bigger career opportunities
* *Learn on the job* – continuous education stipends available

Legacy Service Partners (LSP) is a leading platform of residential HVAC, plumbing, and electrical service providers across the United States. Since our inception in 2021, LSP has partnered with 30+ leading local brands across 16 states, and we are rapidly expanding our footprint.

We exist to serve our Partners and fuel their success. Our role is to create unmatched growth opportunities for our brands so they can better serve their employees, their customers, and their communities. We do this by providing a wide range of world-class resources to support and enhance our local management teams. LSP is guided by three core values – winning together, performance over politics, and today not tomorrow. LSP is backed by Gridiron Capital, a private equity firm specializing in middle market facilities services companies.

  

*Legacy Service Partners is an equal opportunity employer, considering all applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state of federal law.*

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.
company_description: Lion Home Service is a trusted provider of heating, cooling, and electrical solutions in Northern Colorado. We’re built on a foundation of honesty, reliability, and top-quality service.

title: Behavior Support Guide
description:
**St. Vrain Community Montessori School**

**Nautilus Behavior Support Guide**

St. Vrain Community Montessori School fosters human thriving by nurturing the whole child in an authentic Montessori program as a public charter school.

**Reports to:**

Director of Student Services

**Salary/Hourly Range:** $19.50-$33 hourly

**Summary:**

The Nautilus Behavior Support Guide collaborates with other staff members to support students who are experiencing behavior challenges. The primary role of the individual in this position is to respond to Nautilus calls for students in Preschool through 3rd Grade. When not engaged with students, the individual in this position will engage in other tasks, as assigned (e.g., material-making, photocopying, etc.)

**Required Education and Experience:**

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* High school diploma required; college diploma preferred
* 1+ year experience in a Montessori classroom (internship and other relevant experience considered to meet criteria) desired
* Nautilus System of Justness Training (or ability/willingness to obtain training, with the support of SVCMS)

**Required Characteristics, Skills, and Additional Qualifications:**

* Ability to relate sensitively and joyfully to children and adults
* Ability to use appropriate positive discipline
* Evidence of an open mind and a dedication to the Montessori method of education
* Ability to demonstrate sufficient judgment regarding safety and security
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of people
* Ability to handle crises
* Flexibility
* Punctuality and ability to maintain school hours
* Willingness and ability to make student-centered decisions
* Willingness and ability to take on a variety of tasks throughout the day
* Willingness and ability to foster a harmonious, collegial teaching team based on mutual respect

**Major Responsibilities and Duties:**

* Respond to Nautilus calls at the 1055 Building, including:
* Initial engagement with the student and use of deescalation strategies
* Providing the student with tools, activities, and/or other support that they need to return to work
* Engaging in reflection with the student
* Facilitating reentry into the classroom, if call resulted in student leaving the classroom
* Documenting Nautilus call details in a shared spreadsheet
* At times, the response to the Nautilus call will entail covering in the classroom or other learning space (movement, etc.) so that a classroom or Specials Guide can attend to the student
* Attend System of Justness Forum, weekly (remote)
* Facilitate proactive/preemptive breaks for students, as assigned
* Engage in other assigned tasks when not engaging in above-mentioned duties, including but not limited to:
* Material-making and copying
* Filing and other clerical tasks
* Engaging in inventorying, ordering, and receiving materials as well as other tasks related to our upcoming move to a new facility
* Covering in classrooms and reception, as needed

**Other Responsibilities and Duties:**

* Participate in ongoing in-service training
* Attend and participate in leadership, staff, and level meetings and serve on staff committees as required
* Fully participate in in-service and post-service training as well as additional professional development opportunities as required.
* Attend and participate in SVCMS Events, including Family Visiting, Community Education Events, and other Community Building Events, in accordance with the Community Engagement Support Statement.
* Check school email at the beginning and at the end of each work day.
* Be at your scheduled post, ready to begin your duties as scheduled, generally 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., daily.
* When absent, secure a substitute in accordance with SVCMS requirements, ensuring that all of your duties are covered.
* Read the Family Weekly Update, the Staff Weekly Update, and other SVCMS communications.
* Maintain awareness of and adhere to SVCMS school and safety policies and procedures.
* Make a good-faith effort to follow the Four Agreements and treat others as you wish to be treated.

title: Delivery Driver(06357)
description:
**Company Description**

*Team Wow is looking for additional help as our market share continues to grow! Join our team and start planning for your future. We offer schedules that work with you, not against you. Even if you just need a second job for some extra cash, Domino's is the perfect place for you. We are searching for qualified candidates with personality and a desire to please. Sales continue to grow and we live to beat the rush, so come join our family today!! Our commitment to provide excellent customer service and food is nothing without our awesome team members that are always diligent in their work and part of a team environment. What we preach, we practice, and it all starts with you.*

 **Job Description**

Are you a friendly and enthusiastic individual looking for a flexible career opportunity? Join our team as a Delivery Driver at our Brighton, United States location! We're seeking detail-oriented and customer-focused professionals to help us deliver delicious meals to our valued customers with efficiency and a smile.

* Safely transport food orders from our restaurant to customers' homes or businesses
* Provide exceptional customer service by ensuring accurate and timely deliveries
* Navigate efficiently through assigned delivery areas using GPS technology and local knowledge
* Handle cash and credit card transactions accurately
* Maintain a clean and well-organized vehicle
* Assist with various in-store tasks during non-delivery periods, such as food preparation, packaging, and cleaning
* Adhere to all company policies, food safety guidelines, and traffic laws
* Communicate effectively with team members and customers
* Represent the company professionally at all times
* Collaborate with the team to achieve delivery goals and maintain high customer satisfaction

  
**Qualifications**  

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* Valid driver's license with a safe driving record for at least one year
* Reliable, insured vehicle suitable for delivery
* Excellent navigational skills and familiarity with the Brighton area
* Strong customer service orientation and friendly demeanor
* Basic math skills and ability to handle cash transactions accurately
* Effective verbal and written communication skills
* Proficiency in using computer systems and smartphones for order processing and GPS navigation
* Physical ability to lift and carry items up to 50 pounds
* Flexibility to work in various weather conditions and temperatures
* Time management skills and ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment
* Basic food handling knowledge (training will be provided)
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new processes and technologies
* Availability to work various shifts, including evenings and weekends

  
**Additional Information**

Stooping/Bending

Forward bending at the waist is necessary at the pizza assembly station.  
Toe room is present, but workers are unable to flex their knees while standing at this station.  
Duration of this position is approximately 30 - 45 seconds at one time, repeated continuously during the day.  
Forward bending is also present at the front counter and when stocking ingredients.

Crouching/Squatting

Performed occasionally to stock shelves and to clean low areas.

Reaching

Reaching is performed continuously; up, down and forward.  
Workers reach above 72" occasionally to turn on/off oven controls, change prices on sign, and lift and lower objects to and from shelves.  
Workers reaching down to perform such tasks as scooping cornmeal from a plastic barrel, or washing dishes.  
Workers reach forward when obtaining topping ingredients, cleaning work surfaces, or answering phones.

Hand Tasks

Eye-hand coordination is essential. Use of hands is continuous during the day.  
Frequently activities require use of one or both hands.  
Shaping pizza dough requires frequent and forceful use of forearms and wrists.  
Workers must manipulate a pizza peel when removing pizza from the oven, and when using the rolling cutter.  
Frequent and/or forceful pinching is required in the assembly of cardboard pizza boxes.  
Team Members must be able to grasp cans, the phone, the pizza cutter and pizza peel, and pizza boxes.

Machines, Tools, Equipment, Work Aids

Team Members may be required to utilize pencils/pens, computers, telephones, calculators, TDD equipment, pizza cutter and pizza peel.

**DRIVING SPECIFIC JOB DUTIES**

Deliver product by car and then to door of customer.

**REQUIRES**

Valid driver's license with safe driving record meeting company standards.  
Access to an insured vehicle which can be used for delivery.

**ESSENTIAL SKILLS**

Navigational skills to read a map, locate addresses within designated delivery area.  
Must navigate adverse terrain including multi-story buildings, private homes, and other delivery sites while carrying product.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

Carrying

During delivery, carry pizzas and beverages while performing "walking" and "climbing" duties.

Driving

Deliver pizzas within a designated delivery area. A Team Member may make several deliveries per shift.

Walking

Delivery personnel must travel between the store and delivery vehicle and from the delivery vehicle to the customer's location.

Climbing

During delivery of product, navigation of five or more flights of stairs may be required.

**WORK CONDITIONS**

Exposure To

Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when delivering product, driving and couponing.

**SENSING**

Far vision and night vision for driving.
company_description: Founded as a single store in 1960, DPZ is the largest pizza company in the world. From the beginning, Domino’s has been dedicated to the best of service, quality products, and delivery.

title: Corporate Office Manager
description:
**Office Manager**

**Longmont, Colorado**

The **Office Manager** will play a vital role in providing comprehensive, on-site administrative and operational support to ANDE’s Corporate office in Longmont, Colorado. This in-person position offers an exciting opportunity to work closely with a passionate and dynamic team, ensuring a welcoming, organized, well-synced, collaborative, and efficiently run workplace. The Office Manager will be instrumental in facilitating smooth day-to-day operations, bringing both structure and warmth to our Longmont corporate office.

Success in this role requires thriving in a fast-paced, high-growth environment as well as taking ownership of responsibilities, serving as the primary resource for all office and administrative related matters with care and a strong service-oriented mindset.

**What you will do**:

**Office Management:**

* Provides exceptional on-site support services to ensure smooth and productive daily operations of the Longmont office, creating a welcoming, efficient, professional, and well-organized environment.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with vendors, service providers, and building management.
* Responsible for the Longmont facility, coordinating and handling all facility issues including arranging for service, repairs and maintenance directly and/or with property management.
* Creates office procedures; identify and implement process improvements to foster a welcoming and efficient office environment.
* Serves as the primary resource for all administrative and office related matters.
* Support space planning and expense tracking.

**Administrative Support:**

* Provides ongoing office support including answering phone calls, emails, greeting visitors and customers, maintaining office and kitchen supplies, preparing shipments, receiving deliveries, and distributing mail, supplies, and packages.
* Coordinates and manages logistics for internal meetings, events, executive meetings, leadership off-sites, company meetings, and customer events including scheduling, catering, and meeting location.
* Directly provides administrative support to the CEO, ANDE leadership, and their teams.
* Serve as a liaison between executives and stakeholders, ensuring clear and timely communication.
* Communicating with clients providing excellent customer service.
* Coordinate with IT and other departments to support operational needs of executives and staff.
* Support special projects and initiatives as assigned by the CEO and leadership team.
* Organizes and maintains a centralized repository of corporate contracts.
* Manages and tracks key contract dates and milestones.

**What you will bring**

* **7+ years of experience** in office management, executive assistant, or similar roles in a corporate environment. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth business environment and is a highly organized, proactive, dependable, with a dedication to excellent service.
* **Organizational Skills:** Exceptional organizational abilities and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. A track record of sound judgement, meeting deadlines and completing tasks through to conclusion.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to work with senior leadership and handle confidential information with discretion. Ability to interact professionally with employees, clients, and vendors. Demonstrated ability to effectively manage a dynamic, fast paced office with a can-do attitude. Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate across departments. This position requires an effective communicator, who remains composed under pressure, and knows how to keep the office and team aligned and moving forward.
* **Tech Savvy:** Strong Microsoft Suite of Office Tools skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint required), project management tools a plus
* **Problem-Solving and Adaptability:** Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound decisions independently. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Ability to anticipate needs, think critically, and offer solutions to problems with a high level of professionalism.
* **Background Check:** Ability to pass a background check including requirements State and Federal Agencies.
* Valid driver’s license and the ability to drive to locations within Longmont for work related tasks.
* Limited travel may be needed.

**ANDE** is the global leader in Rapid DNA technology. Rapid DNA is the fully automated process of generating a DNA ID, without the need for a technical user or laboratory, in less than two hours. The ANDE system is completely mobile, ruggedized, and designed for use by non-technical users. ANDE is on a mission to help people and make the world a safer place. ANDE Rapid DNA is used for criminal forensics, booking, missing persons, disaster victim identification, sexual assault evidence kit processing, border control, counterterrorism, military operations, government ID uses, as well as in energy and environmental protection.

**ANDE** is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status,

www.ANDE.com

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Will you be able to reliably commute to Longmont, CO 80501 and be in-office Monday-Friday during normal business hours?
* How many years of Office Management/Executive Assistant experience do you have?
* Are you able to pass a background check?

title: Leasing Consultant (REF9728B)
description:
**Multifamily Property Management**

The Leasing Consultant is the community's sales representative and is responsible for interacting with residents (potential and existing) on behalf of FPI to assist with viewing/touring the property, providing accurate information about each apartment home, properly process rental applications, secure lease agreements from qualified persons, and assist with lease renewals as required. The Leasing Consultant is responsible for conducting all job duties in accordance with Fair Housing Laws and Company policy, and supports the overall objective of meeting the expectations of the Client, based on the respective financial operating budget and management agreement.

* Property Name: Caliber at Flatirons

  

* 13872 Del Corso Way, Broomfield, CO 80020, USA

  

* Full-Time

  

* Unit Count: 288

  

* Driving a site-owned golf cart is a requirement for this role. Since driving a site-owned golf cart is a requirement for this role; a valid unrestricted United States Driver's License will be required.

Pay: $19 - $21 / Hour

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

**1.Client Relations**

Carry out the philosophies and wishes of the Owner in the daily overall operations of the apartment community to ensure FPI is meeting the Client objectives and expectations

**2.Communication**

Maintain positive, professional and effective communication with applicants, residents, vendors, clients and guests while representing FPI

**3**.**Leasing/Occupancy**

* Maintain occupancy levels as established by owner/budget expectations
* Exhibit professional leasing techniques
* Assist with the completion of the monthly Market Surveys and analysis
* Assist with advertising and marketing strategies for the apartment community as needed
* Exhibit closing ratios in regards phone and walk-in traffic per FPI policy
* Assist with ensuring that all online marketing sources are updated (e.g., Craigslist) daily
* Promote positive resident/management relations, to retain desirable residents. Place customer need requests and follow up as number one priority.
* Assist with resident retention programs
* Ensure the safety, comfort and privacy of all property residents
* Ensure move-in orientation is completed consistently with new residents

**4.Reporting and Document Management**

* Maintain appropriate resident files including forms, leases, documents in accordance with FPI Standard Operating Procedures.
* Responsible for the daily integrity and confidentiality of resident files.
* Ensure that documents and reporting systems are maintained, updated, and organized.
* May assist in periodic reporting requirements as requested

**5. Risk Management**

* Ensure compliance of Risk Management items through the following of the FPI Standard Operating Procedures.
* Reports timely any/all injuries, illnesses, property damage through the proper reporting channels and forms.
* React calmly and professionally in emergency, emotional and/or stressful situations.

**6. Facility Maintenance**

* Assist residents with reporting of maintenance needs.
* Document facility and maintenance needs and ensure timely completion. c. Ongoing monitoring of the physical asset and identifying concerns with immediate supervisor.
* Follow up on maintenance requests to promote resident communication and satisfaction.

**7. Other**

* Consistently and fairly enforce community rules and regulations, FPI Standard Operating Procedures.
* Comply with all Fair Housing Laws and FPI policies and procedures.
* Promote a professional image by adhering to FPI Management's Dress Code Policy.
* Conduct displayed must be of a professional manner when communicating with employees, residents, prospective residents, clients, vendors, and guests while representing FPI Management.
* Responsible for meeting all training requirements for the position (Grace Hill, Safety Meetings, etc.).
* Perform any and all functions as directed by the supervisor, including special project assistance.

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Minimum 1 year of experience in a similar role, preferably within Residential Property Management. Experience in hospitality, retail, sales or customer service will also be considered.
* High School diploma or equivalency certificate required.
* Must be proficient in speaking, reading, and writing in English.
* Strong computer skills (MS Office, Google Apps, property management-related software, email, internet, social media).

**Skills Required:**

* Basic Computer Skills
* Customer Service
* Google Drive
* Google Mail (GMail)
* Internet Use
* RealPage

**ESSENTIAL ATTRIBUTES**

* Embracing and exemplifying our **HEART** core values and incorporating them into every task performed and every interaction with clients, supervisors, team members, colleagues, residents, vendors, etc.
* Positive influencing, interpersonal, and communication skills are essential.

**Why look at FPI for your next career step?** We are one of the largest third-party 100% fee-managed Property Management companies in the nation, an industry leader in both the Conventional and Affordable Housing spaces, managing over 850 communities (~150,000 units) across the country, and employing ~3,500 team members. We offer comprehensive compensation and benefits packages (employee-only employer-paid plan available), ongoing training, and plenty of opportunities to grow your career. Come join Team FPI!

**EEO/EVerify Statements**

FPI Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply. FPI Management participates in the E-Verify program.
company_description: FPI is a privately owned, exclusive third party, multifamily property manager.

title: Insurance Sales Representative
description:
**Job Overview**
----------------

**Summit Insurance** is an elite mega agency recognized as one of the Allstate's Top 20. We are dedicated to providing a unique experience, prioritizing talent and potential over prior experience. With a staff of 20, including specialized service and sales teams, we foster a team environment driven by accountability and flexibility. Our goal is to offer a distinctive experience to our clients while enabling our team members to grow and thrive in their roles.

We are seeking an **Insurance Sales Representative** who is motivated to learn and grow. We value potential and talent, offering a comprehensive training program for those new to the industry. This position includes a competitive salary with additional commission and bonus opportunities.

**Base Salary:** $42,000 annually

**Total Annual Compensation Potential with Commission and Bonus Opportunities of $72,000-$130,000+**

If you are ready to join a dynamic and supportive team at Summit Insurance, where you can grow and succeed in your insurance career, we want to hear from you!

  

**Apply today** to become part of our elite team and provide a unique insurance experience to our clients.

Salary Range: $42,000.00 per year

**Benefits**
------------

Annual Base Salary + Commission

Paid Time Off (PTO)  
Flexible Schedule  
Health Insurance  
Hands on Training  
Retirement Plan  
Evenings Off  
Annual Base Salary + Commission + Bonus Opportunities  
Bonus Opportunities  
Warm Leads Provided  
Licensing Assistance  
Work-Life Balance  
Holidays Off  
Professional Development  
Advancement Opportunities  
Mentorship  
Performance Bonuses  
Professional Work Environment  
Equipment Provided  
Monday to Friday (8:30am-5PM) Work Schedule  
License Requirement After 90 Days

**Requirements**
----------------

* **No previous experience required!**
* Must be coachable and willing to get your Colorado Property and Casualty License.
* License Reimbursement paid after 90 days of obtaining licnse.
* Collaborative and supportive team members who foster a positive work environment
* Proactive and motivated individual who takes initiative without constant supervision
* Driven by achieving personal and professional goals.
* Clear and effective communication skills, both written and verbal
* Polite, courteous, and professional phone manner.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Cultivates and maintains strong relationships with clients.
* Conduct timely follow-ups to address client inquiries and concerns.
* Deliver engaging sales presentations to showcase product benefits.
* Actively seek referrals and expand professional networks.
* Follow up on warm leads provided by the company.
* Initiate cold calls to identify potential clients and professional relationships.
* Provide comprehensive insurance education and guidance.
* Position begins as a telemarketer while completing license and undergoing training (hourly position, transitioning to salary once attaining sales role)

**About Us**
------------

The Summit Insurance name has been closely associated with Allstate for years to help people with their insurance needs including Life, Home, Auto, Commercial and more. Our quality, service-oriented agency is driven to be the trusted advisor that people can count on. We will be there for you, in person, when you need us.

title: Automotive Service Manager 5+ years automotive exp
description:
Hansen Automotive is launching a brand-new, state-of-the-art automotive service center dedicated to delivering exceptional customer service, honest diagnostics, and reliable repairs. Our mission is to continue to build a trusted name in the community by combining integrity, expertise, and a customer-first approach. We are currently seeking a motivated and experienced **Service Center Manager/Service Advisor** to help bring this vision to life.

**Job Description:**  
As the Service Center Manager/Service Advisor, you will play a key role in establishing and growing the business from the ground up. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of the service center, lead a passionate team, and build lasting relationships with customers in the community.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead the launch and day-to-day operations of the automotive service center.
* Hire, train, and manage a team of technicians and front-office staff.
* Develop and implement service protocols, customer care standards, and operational workflows.
* Establish strong relationships with vendors, suppliers, and parts distributors.
* Build and grow a loyal customer base through excellent service and community outreach.
* Monitor performance metrics and ensure high levels of productivity and customer satisfaction.
* Maintain a safe, clean, and professional work environment.
* Uphold high ethical standards and promote a culture of integrity and accountability.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience managing an automotive service center or related business.
* Strong understanding of local automotive market, customer needs, and service trends.
* Ability to hire, lead, and inspire a team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
* A passion for customer service and community involvement.
* High moral values and a commitment to doing what’s right—even when no one is watching.
* ASE certifications or technical background a plus.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
* Health, Dental, Vision.
* Paid time off.
* Opportunity to grow with a new and expanding company.
* Flexible and supportive leadership environment.
* Autonomy to build and shape the service center’s culture and operations.
* Career growth and development opportunities.

**How to Apply:**  
Please send your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you’re excited about this opportunity to HR@ADASservicecenters.com

title: Line Cook- Tap & Burger Westminster
description:
**Attention Line Cooks!**

Our Tap & Burger in Westminster is looking for a line cook! Come join our awesome and fun team! Please respond with your resume and what your availability would be.

**Expected compensation $21-$24/hr (base plus service charge). Weekend availability is a must! We're looking for part time to start!**

The Culinary Creative Group is more than just a hospitality management group; we are a culture and a philosophy; we have a strong belief in diversity, equity and inclusion; we are a community-focused, activist business.

We provide career opportunities; we aren’t “a job,” people who work for us come to build careers. Our management umbrella includes: Aviano, A5 Steakhouse, Senor Bear, Ash’Kara, Mister Oso, Forget Me Not, and Tap & Burger Concepts, with plans to open new restaurants this year as well as an event company and a consulting company.

Our concepts have been represented on Bon Appetit’s 50 best restaurants in America and have been listed amongst the most anticipated restaurants list nationally from Food and Wine magazine as recently as March with our new cocktail bar Forget Me Not.

*We strongly adhere to the following:*

**- Our Mission:** We create businesses that are welcoming, purposeful, and community driven.

**-Our Vision:** To be progressive, socially-conscious leaders in our community.

**-Our Values:** We exhibit an absolute devotion to guest and employee welfare. We do this courteously, with humility, honesty, integrity, and professionalism. We have a bias for action, and a propensity towards making decisions that leave our world a better place.

At Mister Oso, our love language is food and drink. The food is deeply personal and is rooted in a sense of place and time; our service is warm and professional. We choose to elevate who we serve over what we serve. Our service is executed best when we treat guests with kindness, respect, and humility.

If you possess the following qualities we want to hear from you:

* Reliability + Trustworthiness
* Great Communication Skills
* Attention to detail + Organization
* You value the guest experience and take pride in your job.

*What You’ll Love About Us:*

* **Lucrative Pay:** We believe in pay equity and that everyone should invest in a quality experience for our guests and our employees.
* **A place to grow your career:** we believe in growing and mentoring talent within our restaurants by focusing on growing staff and fostering leadership.
* **Benefits:** All of our full time employees are eligible to participate in company health, dental, and vision insurance plans. Part time benefits available as well. Your company discount is extended to all restaurants in the group. There are ample opportunities to volunteer in community projects, to cross-train in other disciplines, and to stage throughout the group.
* **Collaboration:** By fostering small, tightly knit teams we want you to closely work with our creative team and to work with us to create a healthy and vibrant work environment.

Please reply with your resume and preferred form of contact, we look forward to learning more about you.

The Culinary Creative is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $21.00 - $24.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* Night/day shift

Weekly day range:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekend availability

title: Tax Manager
description:
**TAX MANAGER**

***Why Hattig CPA?***

* **Ownership Opportunity**: We’re seeking a passionate, entrepreneurial-minded tax leader with a desire to own their own firm.
* **Team Approach**: We’re a small firm, so you’ll work directly with senior leadership and have the autonomy to manage your clients.
* **Our Culture**: We’re laid back – we value work-life balance with flexible schedules, hybrid work and Fridays off for half the year!

Hattig CPA, a full-service public accounting firm located in Longmont, CO, provides a full spectrum of tax and accounting services to privately held businesses and high net worth individuals. We are currently seeking a self-motivated, hands-on tax leader with 7+ years of recent public accounting tax experience for a critical role managing tax and accounting engagements for a diverse roster of clients.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and review tax returns including complex federal, multi-state and local individual, trust, partnership, and S & C Corporate income returns
* Lead engagements throughout all phases of tax and accounting including research, projections, planning and client consulting
* Design and implement team development activities
* Build and manage professional client relationships

**Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of recent public accounting tax experience
* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or equivalent experience
* CPA license or EA designation
* Solid understanding of tax law, business and individual accounting and best practices
* Strong communication, organizational, research, analytical, problem-solving, and PC skills including Microsoft Office, QuickBooks Desktop and QuickBooks Online and tax software proficiency (Lacerte software proficiency is a plus)
* Ability to think like a CPA practice owner, see the big picture and juggle priorities
* Positive attitude, strong work ethic, desire to learn and a passion to service clients
* Project management experience is a plus

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
* 401k plan with employer match
* Supplemental insurance
* Generous PTO/vacation/holidays
* Flexible schedules, hybrid work and Fridays off for half the year!
* Opportunities for advancement including potential ownership
* Family-oriented, professional and collaborative office environment

We’re committed to fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.​ Join us and be part of a firm where your contributions truly matter. Submit your resume by clicking ‘Apply’ above.

*Hattig CPA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

title: Front Desk Patient Coordinator- (Part-time or Summer Season)
description:
**JPart-Time Treatment Coordinator – Make a Lasting Impact in Oral Surgery Care**

Are you an upbeat, detail-loving professional who enjoys helping patients feel confident and cared for? Do you thrive in a dynamic, high-touch environment where your organizational skills and friendly personality can truly shine? If so, we’d love to meet you!

We're looking for a Part-Time Patient Coordinator to join our passionate and patient-focused oral surgery team. As the face of our practice, you'll set the tone for an exceptional experience—ensuring every patient feels seen, heard, and supported from the moment they walk through our door.

This is an ideal opportunity for someone looking to balance meaningful work with schedule flexibility, while being part of a collaborative and high-performing team.

**What You'll Do**

**Patient Experience & Communication**

* Greet and check in patients with warmth and professionalism
* Manage incoming calls and voicemails with efficiency and care
* Register new patients and ensure accurate entry into our system
* Communicate clearly with patients via phone, email, and in-office—always HIPAA-compliant
* Prepare correspondence, post-op letters, and maintain a polished front office environment

**Appointment Coordination**

* Schedule and confirm appointments to keep the day flowing smoothly
* Adjust or reschedule appointments as needed, maintaining optimal clinic efficiency
* Ensure charts, referral letters, and imaging are organized and ready for the clinical team
* Collaborate closely with the surgical team to streamline daily operations

**What You Bring to the Team**

* A natural knack for customer service and relationship-building
* Sharp organizational skills and a calm presence under pressure
* Strong communication—professional, empathetic, and clear
* Tech comfort: you’re at ease with Microsoft Office, practice management software, and phone systems
* Team-first attitude with the ability to work independently
* Integrity, reliability, and a genuine passion for helping others

**Qualifications**

* High school diploma required; college degree a plus
* 2+ years in a medical/dental administrative role
* Experience with insurance verification and patient financial discussions
* Familiarity with treatment plan presentation is strongly preferred
* CPR certification preferred (or willingness to obtain)

**Position Details**

* **Job Type:** Part-Time (approximately 20–25 hours/week, with potential for growth)
* **Hourly Pay:** $22.00 – $26.00, based on experience
* **Location:** in-office
* **Schedule:** Flexible within standard business hours (specific days/times to be discussed)

**Why You’ll Love Working With Us**

We’re more than a practice, we’re a team of caring professionals committed to providing exceptional patient care in a supportive and respectful environment. We believe in empowering our team, celebrating wins, and continually learning and growing together.

If you're ready to bring your skills, your heart, and your positive energy to a team that values you, apply today!

title: Join Our Small, Cozy, Functional Dental Office!
description:
Are you a compassionate dental hygienist who’s ready to learn about the root cause of dental disease? At **Mindful Dentistry**, we believe oral health is whole-body health—and we’re looking for a like-minded **part-time hygienist** to join our warm, close-knit team.

**Why You'll Love It Here**

* We’re a **cozy, functional dental office** that feels more like a wellness sanctuary than a clinic.
* We’re **airway-focused** and educate our patients (and each other!) about the root causes of oral-systemic conditions.
* We support and invest in **continuing education** and regularly attend courses on airway health, myofunctional therapy, ozone, lasers, and more.
* You'll work in a peaceful environment where **patients are listened to and truly cared for**.
* No corporate red tape. Just authentic care, meaningful work, and a team that laughs together.

*Are you a detail-oriented, experienced, self-motivated and passionate receptionist/****patient/insurance/financial coordinator*** *looking for a new opportunity? Our small but welcoming dental office is looking for someone special to join our team and provide exceptional care to our patients.*

**About Us:** At Mindful Dentistry, we pride ourselves on creating a warm and educating environment where both our patients and staff feel valued and cared for. We believe in a functional approach to dental and overall health and are committed to providing top-notch services in a supportive setting.

We prioritize work/life balance and operate on a 4-day work week, from 9 AM to 4 or 5 PM, with no weekends.

**What We Offer:**

* **Great Pay:** Competitive salary that values your skills and experience ($25-30)
* **401K and 401K Match:** Secure your future with our comprehensive retirement plan.
* **Paid Time Off (PTO):** Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with generous PTO.
* **Free Dental Care:** Access to top-quality dental care at no cost.
* **Holistic Training:** Learn cutting-edge holistic dental technologies, including ozone therapy, laser treatment, and safe amalgam removal.
* **Laser Aesthetic Procedures:** Our office is adding laser aesthetic procedures such as lip plumping, laser peel, and Smoothlase. These procedures are available for staff as a benefit.
* **Work/Life Balance:** We work 4 days a week from 9 AM to 4 or 5 PM, with no weekends, allowing you to enjoy your personal time. This particular part time position is for Wednesday 9-5, every other Monday 9-5 and every other Friday 9-2 with opportunity for more hours in the future.

**How to Apply:** Send your resume and a cover letter to themindfuldentistry@gmail.com. We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to our family!

Join our team to be part of a warm and welcoming dental office that values patient care and teamwork.

Expected hours: 13 – 16 per week

* Continuing education credits
* Employee mentoring program
* Professional development assistance

* No weekends

title: Accela Senior Business Analyst
description:
Link Technologies (LinkTechConsulting.com), a Las Vegas-based IT consulting firm, is currently seeking an Accela Senior Business Analyst to join our team.

***JOB SUMMARY***  
This position serves as a liaison between business users, functional subject matter experts, systems analysts, and technical developers. Responsibilities include analyzing business processes by assessing current and future state process flows, documenting process diagrams, eliciting and documenting requirements, performing system fit/gap analysis, contributing to design specifications, developing and overseeing technology-related request for proposals, and participating in systems testing. As a key member of technology services, this role contributes to delivering high customer value through innovative solutions and plays a crucial part in exceeding customer expectations.

***QUALIFICATIONS***

* Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, mathematics or a related field. o Additional appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for the minimum education requirement on a one (1) year for one (1) year basis.

***Minimum of five (5) years of recent, professional-level experience in business analysis, including at least two (2) years in a lead role on projects of varying sizes. This experience should include:***

* Leading process analysis and improvement initiatives that span multiple teams or departments.
* Identifying and delivering enterprise-wide system enhancement recommendations.
* Conducting technical evaluations in complex, highly integrated software system environments.
* Developing process and system diagrams to document current and future state operations.
* Producing end-user training documentation or converting technical content into training materials.
* Creating process handoff and system integration diagrams across interconnected systems.
* Collaborating effectively with peers, customers, and vendors to achieve shared outcomes.
* Assisting both technical and non-technical stakeholders in understanding the impact of process handoffs on requirements and system integrations.
* Clearly documenting workflows for use by internal teams and organizational leadership.
* Defining requirements to integrate new tools into existing technical infrastructure.

***ADDITIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED***

* Must be able to obtain CJIS Certification within 90 days from start date.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Highly self-motivated with strong organizational abilities.
* Focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences.
* Proficient in facilitating customer interactions and engagements.
* Skilled in problem analysis and root cause identification.
* Effective in preparing and delivering presentations on a variety of topics.
* Experienced in building consensus and managing conflict.
* Capable of conducting successful negotiations.

***PREFERRED EXPERIENCE***

* Experience across a broad spectrum of technology solutions
* ITIL/ITSM
* Agile/Scrum
* Business Process Management (BPM)
* Lean Six Sigma / Lean process development
* Change Management
* Business case development and delivery
* Accela or similar workflow platforms
* Experience with AI tools is a plus
* Microsoft Office including Visio, Azure DevOps

***RESPONSIBILITIES***

* Act as principal liaison for business stakeholders and as a key point-of-contact to technology services, internal/external agencies, and vendors on their behalf.
* Facilitate team understanding and elicit requirements for systems, integrations, and future state functionality.
* Partner with business stakeholders to identify problems/opportunities, assist in developing these into project/initiatives, and work within technology services to move these into the project pipeline.
* Understand business processes and system capabilities for complex, integrated systems.
* Work with vendors to understand system intricacies and process needs to advocate for the best possible solution.
* Utilize Azure Dev Ops (ADO) for all project tracking purposes.
* Create functional process fit/gap analysis documentation which identifies and recommends resolution of any process, system, and integration related gaps.
* Make suggestions for any as-is or to-be processes which are lacking and/or present a risk and help mitigate them, before they become an issue.
* Follow TS best practices: documentation, project, and change management processes.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders, technology services teams, internal/external agencies, vendors, et. al to support the organization’s mission, vision, and goals.

***Pay range: $60-$65/hr***

Link Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors protected by law.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Westminster, CO 80031
